H0.text: The passenger piegon was the once most common bird in North America that became extinct in the 1800s.

H1.text: The dodo was the once most common bird in North America that became extinct in the 1800s.

H2.text: The homing piegon was the once most common bird in North America that became extinct in the 1800s.

H3.text: The rock penguin was once the most common bird in North America but became extinct in the 1800s.

A4.text: It was once the most abundant bird in North America, numbering around 3 billion, and possibly up to 5 billion.

A5.text: In 1900, the last confirmed wild bird was shot in southern Ohio.

A6.text: Martha was the last passenger pigeon.

A7.text: The passenger pigeon was thought to account for up to 40% of all individual birds on the continent before European colonization.

A8.text: The main drivers of the passenger pigeonâ€™s extinction were habitat destruction and overhunting.
